question.feedback: False is correct. The month property, which is in a numeric format with 0 for January up to 11 for December

item.question: In Date class,the month property value is in a numeric format with 1 for January up to 12 for December.True or False?

question.feedback: monthUTC is correct. In fact, the Date class gives you a number of ways to get each of these values. For example, you can get the month value of a Date object in four different ways:The month property,The getMonth() method,The monthUTC property,The getMonthUTC() method

item.question: How you will get the month value of a Date object from Date class.

question.feedback: C is correct. var str:String = 'Hello from Paris, Texas!!!'; trace(str.slice(11,15)); output: Pari trace(str.slice(-3,-1)); output: !! trace(str.slice(-3,26)); output: !!! trace(str.slice(-3,str.length));output: !!! trace(str.slice(-8,-3)); // output: Texas

item.question: Given the following sample code, what will be output in the trace statement? Choose one. var str:String = "Hello from Paris,Texas!!!";trace(str.slice(-8,-3));

question.feedback: A,B, are correct. The String class includes the following methods for working with patterns in strings:Use the match() and search() methods to locate substrings that match a pattern.Use the replace() method to find substrings that match a pattern and replace them with a specified substring.

question.feedback: D, is correct. Empty items in the array are not supported; a statement such as var v:Vector.<int> = new <int>[0,,2,] throws a compiler error.

item.question: Given the following sample code, What will be output in the trace statement? var v:Vector.<int> = new <int>[0,,2,]

question.feedback: True is correct. If a Vector object’s fixed property is true, the total number of elements in the Vector can’t change. If you try to add a new element to a fixed-length Vector using the techniques described here, an error occurs.

item.question: True or False:If a Vector object’s fixed property is true, the total number of elements in the Vector can’t change.

question.feedback: C, is correct. Three methods of the Array and Vector classes—pop(), shift(), and splice()—allow you to remove elements. The pop() method removes an element from the end of the array. In other words, it removes the element at the highest index number. The shift() method removes an element from the beginning of the array, which means that it always removes the element at index number 0. The splice() method, which can also be used to insert elements, removes an arbitrary number of elements starting at the index number specified by the first argument sent to the method.

item.question: Which method can used to insert elements, removes an arbitrary number of elements starting at the index number specified by the first argument sent to the method.

question.feedback: True is correct. The Vector class does not include a sortOn() method. This method is only available for Array objects

item.question: The Vector class does not include a sortOn() method.

question.feedback: True is correct. When you use two indexed arrays, you can visualize the result as a table or spreadsheet. The elements of the first array represent the rows of the table, while the elements of the second array represent the columns.

item.question: When you use two indexed arrays, you can visualize the result as a table or spreadsheet.true or false?

question.feedback: B, is correct. An EOFError exception is thrown when you attempt to read past the end of the available data.

item.question: Which exception will be thrown when you attempt to read past the end of the available data.?

question.feedback: B, is correct. You can also resize a Rectangle object by using the inflate() method, which includes two parameters, dx and dy. The dx parameter represents the number of pixels that the left and right sides of the rectangle moves from the center. The dy parameter represents the number of pixels that the top and bottom of the rectangle moves from the center

item.question: Which of the following method is used to resize the Rectangle Object.?

question.feedback: B, is correct. The Panel and NavigatorContent classes are subclasses of the SkinnableContainer class.

item.question: The Panel and NavigatorContent classes are subclasses of the ___________ class? which of the following is correct one?

question.feedback: C, is correct. The default layout class of the Group and SkinnableContainer container is BasicLayout.

item.question: The default layout class of the Group and SkinnableContainer container is?

question.feedback: B, is correct. The BorderContainer container provides a set of CSS styles and class properties to control the border and background of the container.

item.question: Which container will provides a set of CSS styles and class properties to control the border and background of the container?

question.feedback: True is correct. You cannot use Spark containers other than NavigatorContent as a child of an MX navigator container. To use any other Spark container in a navigator container, wrap it in an MX container or in the Spark NavigatorContent container.

item.question: You cannot use Spark containers other than NavigatorContent as a child of an MX navigator container.

question.feedback: B, is correct. Flex generates a dragEnter event when the user moves the drag indicator over any component. A component must define a handler for a dragEnter event to be a drop target

item.question: Which event will Flex generates when the user moves the drag indicator over any component?

question.feedback: A,C, are correct. The DateValidator and CreditCardValidator can validate multiple fields by using a single validator. A CreditCardValidator examines one field that contains the credit card number and a second field that contains the credit card type. The DateValidator can examine a single field that contains a date, or multiple fields that together make up a date.

item.question: Which of the following validator can validate multiple fields by using a single validator?

question.feedback: A, is correct. For United States ZIP codes, only numeric characters are valid. For Canadian postal codes, alphanumeric characters are allowed. Alphabetic characters must be in uppercase.

item.question: In ZipCodeFormatter class, For Canadian postal codes, ___________ characters are allowed?

question.feedback: True is correct. In ActionScript or an MXML tag, you cannot use hyphenated style property names, so you must use the camel-case version of the style property. For the style name in a style sheet, you cannot use a hyphenated name

item.question: True or False:In Cascading Stylesheet, the name of class selectors cannot inculde hyphenated style property names in Actionscript and an MXML tag.

question.feedback: True is correct. When you assign styles to a type selector, all subclasses of that selector’s type (the class) are affected by the styles. For example, if you create a type selector for Group, the styles are also applied to VGroup and HGroup instances because those classes are subclasses of Group.

item.question: True or False:When you assign styles to a type selector, all subclasses of that selector’s type (the class) are affected by the styles.?

question.feedback: B is correct. Styles are applied only to components that appear in the display list. Descendant selectors are only applied if the ancestors also appear in the display list.Descendant selectors work with all classes that implement the IStyleClient interface.

item.question: Descendant selectors work with all classes which implements the following interface.?

question.feedback: D, is correct. A list component dispatches the following events as part of the cell editing process: the itemEditBeginning, itemEditBegin, and the itemEditEnd events. The list-based controls define default event listeners for all three of these events

item.question: A list component dispatches whic events as part of the cell editing process.

question.feedback: C, is correct. All chart controls, except the PieChart class, are subclasses of the CartesianChart class. Cartesian charts are charts that typically represent a set of data points in rectangular-shaped, two-dimensional space. The PieChart class is a subclass of the PolarChart class, which represents data in circular space.

item.question: All chart controls are subclasses of the CartesianChart class,except one of the following chart class?

question.feedback: B, is correct. A LinearAxis class maps numeric data to the axis. You use the <mx:LinearAxis> child tag of the <mx:horizontalAxis> or <mx:verticalAxis> tags to customize the range of values displayed along the axis, and to set the increment between the axis labels of the tick marks.

item.question: Which of the following class maps numeric data to the axis?

question.feedback: C, is correct. Bidirectional, or two-way, data binding occurs when two objects act as the source and the destination for each other. When you modify the source property of either object, the destination property of the other object is updated.

item.question: When two objects act as the source and the destination for each other. This process is called.?

question.feedback: True is correct. Spark skins can be loaded and unloaded at run time, and their properties can be bound to the style properties of the host component.

item.question: Spark skins can be loaded and unloaded at compile time, and their properties can be bound to the style properties of the host component.

question.feedback: D, is correct. The Bounce class defines three easing functions to implement bounce motion with Flex effect classes.easeOut(),easeIn() and easeInOut().

item.question: Which of the following are the easing function for Bounce class to implement bounce motion with flex effect classes?
